page.title: 10Halton House ,Aston Clinton
page.content: In 1850 ,the Rothschilds purchased the Halton Estate and a large house was built. The army owned it in 1913 and used it to train cadets. In 1917 the airmen came into the picture and used Halton House as offices. The process whereby Halton Park passed from the Rothschilds into the less gentle hands of the War Office has been obscured by the passing years. One modern version is that Alfred Rothschild presented the entire estate to the hard-pressed government as a gift. The other is that the War Office, armed with emergency powers, imposed compulsory purchase, and Alfred promptly died of a broken heart.These days servicemen occupy the estate and use it as an officer's mess, soldiers also receive medals at Halton House.
